1.1.1.policy_name: Ensure 'Minimum password age' is set to '1 or more day(s)'
1.1.1.gpo_path: Computer Configuration\Policies\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy
1.1.1.verification_command: $value = Get-ItemPropertyValue -Path 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netlogon\Parameters' -Name 'MinimumPasswordAge' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; if ($value -ge 1) { Write-Log "✓ Minimum password age verified" -Level SUCCESS } else { Write-Log "✗ Minimum password age verification failed" -Level ERROR }
1.1.1.remediation_notes: Affects password policy domain-wide if system is domain controller

1.1.2.policy_name: Ensure 'Maximum password age' is set to '365 or fewer days, but not 0'
1.1.2.gpo_path: Computer Configuration\Policies\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy
1.1.2.verification_command: $value = Get-ItemPropertyValue -Path 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netlogon\Parameters' -Name 'MaximumPasswordAge' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; if ($value -le 365 -and $value -gt 0) { Write-Log "✓ Maximum password age verified" -Level SUCCESS } else { Write-Log "✗ Maximum password age verification failed" -Level ERROR }
1.1.2.remediation_notes: Setting to 0 means passwords never expire - not recommended

2.2.1.policy_name: Ensure 'Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller' is set to 'No One'
2.2.1.gpo_path: Computer Configuration\Policies\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment
2.2.1.gpo_setting: Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller
2.2.1.verification_command: $value = Get-ItemPropertyValue -Path 'HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System' -Name 'SeTrustedCredManAccessPrivilege' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; if ([string]::IsNullOrEmpty($value)) { Write-Log "✓ Access Credential Manager privilege properly restricted" -Level SUCCESS } else { Write-Log "✗ Access Credential Manager privilege verification failed" -Level ERROR }
2.2.1.remediation_notes: Removes the ability for applications to access stored credentials

2.3.1.1.policy_name: Ensure 'Accounts: Block Microsoft accounts' is set to 'Users can't add or log on with Microsoft accounts'
2.3.1.1.gpo_path: Computer Configuration\Policies\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options
2.3.1.1.verification_command: $value = Get-ItemPropertyValue -Path 'HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System' -Name 'NoConnectedUser' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; if ($value -eq 3) { Write-Log "✓ Microsoft accounts properly blocked" -Level SUCCESS } else { Write-Log "✗ Microsoft accounts blocking verification failed" -Level ERROR }
2.3.1.1.remediation_notes: Prevents users from adding Microsoft accounts for authentication

2.3.1.2.policy_name: Ensure 'Accounts: Guest account status' is set to 'Disabled'
2.3.1.2.gpo_path: Computer Configuration\Policies\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options
2.3.1.2.verification_command: $value = Get-ItemPropertyValue -Path 'HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon' -Name 'GuestAccountStatus' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; if ($value -eq 0) { Write-Log "✓ Guest account properly disabled" -Level SUCCESS } else { Write-Log "✗ Guest account status verification failed" -Level ERROR }
2.3.1.2.remediation_notes: Disables the built-in Guest account for security

2.3.7.1.policy_name: Ensure 'Interactive logon: Do not require CTRL+ALT+DEL' is set to 'Disabled'
2.3.7.1.gpo_path: Computer Configuration\Policies\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options
2.3.7.1.gpo_setting: Interactive logon: Do not require CTRL+ALT+DEL
2.3.7.1.verification_command: $value = Get-ItemPropertyValue -Path 'HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System' -Name 'DisableCAD' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; if ($value -eq 0) { Write-Log "✓ CTRL+ALT+DEL requirement verified" -Level SUCCESS } else { Write-Log "✗ CTRL+ALT+DEL requirement verification failed" -Level ERROR }
2.3.7.1.remediation_notes: Requires CTRL+ALT+DEL for interactive logon security

18.1.1.1.policy_name: Ensure 'Prevent enabling lock screen camera' is set to 'Enabled'
18.1.1.1.verification_command: $value = Get-ItemPropertyValue -Path 'HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Personalization' -Name 'NoLockScreenCamera' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; if ($value -eq 1) { Write-Log "✓ Lock screen camera prevention verified" -Level SUCCESS } else { Write-Log "✗ Lock screen camera prevention verification failed" -Level ERROR }
18.1.1.1.remediation_notes: Prevents camera access from lock screen for privacy

18.9.8.1.policy_name: Ensure 'Block all consumer Microsoft account user authentication' is set to 'Enabled'
18.9.8.1.gpo_setting: Block all consumer Microsoft account user authentication
18.9.8.1.verification_command: $value = Get-ItemPropertyValue -Path 'HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\MicrosoftAccount' -Name 'DisableUserAuth' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; if ($value -eq 1) { Write-Log "✓ Microsoft account authentication blocking verified" -Level SUCCESS } else { Write-Log "✗ Microsoft account authentication blocking verification failed" -Level ERROR }
18.9.8.1.remediation_notes: Blocks consumer Microsoft account authentication in enterprise environments
